author: guitargeek
body:
#### PR description:

Hi! One pieces of the EgammaElectronAlgos that I do not really like is the ElectronHcalHelper, because it is essentially a non-threadsafe wrapper around EgammaTowerIsolation. I don't think this abstraction layer is needed. Using the isolation classes directly results in shorter and more direct code, enables a few conversions from stream to global plugins among the EgammaHLTProducer plugins and we can also use this opportunity to spread some usage of `ESGetToken` instead of manual cashing of event setup products. Also, not using it removes the dependence of the EgammaHLTProducers on libEgammaElectronAlgos.

#### PR validation:

CMSSW compiles and local matrix tests pass.

#### if this PR is a backport please specify the original PR:

No backport intended.
title: Don't use ElectronHcalHelper in EgammaHLTProducers
